class AlertBox

Detailed Description

Interface used to allow the creator of a dialog to be notified when a list item on the dialog is clicked.

The following example demonstrates how to use the IDialogOnMultiChoiceClickListener. 

  //You need implement your owner OnMultiChoiceClick Listener for AlertBox
  class MyDialogMultiChoiceClick : gaia::core::IDialogOnMultiChoiceClickListener {
    public:
      MyDialogMultiChoiceClick();
      virtual ~MyDialogMultiChoiceClick();
      void onClick(int32_t which, bool isChecked);
  };

  void MyDialogMultiChoiceClick::onClick(int32_t which, bool isChecked) {
    //When click item from MultiChoice, it will use callback to notify.
    //Your Implementation
  }

  //In your AlertBox, just register the callback by setMultiChoiceItems
  gaia::core::AlertBox* alert = new gaia::core::AlertBox(Page);
  MyDialogMultiChoiceClick* listener = new MyDialogMultiChoiceClick();
  if (listener == NULL) {
    //DialogOnMultiChoiceClickListener create failure!!
    return;
  }

  if (alert != NULL) {
    //initial MultiChoice Items
    gaia::base::StringArray instringArray(5);
    instringArray.replaceAt("Multi 1", 0);
    instringArray.replaceAt("Multi 2", 1);
    instringArray.replaceAt("Multi 3", 2);
    instringArray.replaceAt("Multi 4", 3);
    instringArray.replaceAt("Multi 5", 4);
    bool checkedArray[5];
    for (i = 0; i < 5; i++) {
      checkedArray[i] = false;
    }

    //register listener
    alert->setMultiChoiceItems(instringArray, checkedArray, listener);
  }

virtual void gaia::ui::IDialogOnMultiChoiceClickListener::onClick ( int32_t  which,
bool  isChecked 
) [pure virtual]

This method will be invoked when an item in the dialog is clicked.

Parameters:
whichThe position of the item in the list that was clicked.
isCheckedTrue if the click checked the item, else false.
